Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (fired red); part of added white outline of lotus; exterior: painted decoration consisting of top of sphinx’s head, to left; at upper left, undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: The number '876' is written in pencil on the interior of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 288, no. 852, pl. 118)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1043) (phase 2)
